reviews.reviewText:
LuLu Market is one of the best places to shop for groceries, fresh produce, household items, and more. The store is always clean, well-organized, and fully stocked with both local and international products. The quality of fruits, vegetables, and meat is top-notch, and prices are quite reasonable compared to other supermarkets.

The staff is friendly and helpful, and the billing counters are efficient with minimal waiting time. I also appreciate the wide aisles and air-conditioned comfort, which make shopping here a pleasant experience. Whether you're doing your weekly shopping or just grabbing a few items, LuLu Market never disappoints.

Highly recommended for quality, variety, and great customer service!

Customer service was good. One stop to buy all households. Vegetables and fruits were fresh. Place is clean. Ample parking spaces available and it was easy to find parking on a Sunday afternoon. Bakery items were average. Plenty of meats were available. Sad to see few people open and eating the food items from the rack. Make sure to carry your own bag, they charge Rs. 15 for a bag.

LuLu Hypermarket in Coimbatore is an excellent shopping destination with a huge variety of groceries, fresh fruits, vegetables, bakery items, and household essentials all under one roof.

The store is spacious, clean, and well-organized, making shopping comfortable. The food counters and bakery are worth trying, and prices are reasonable for the quality offered. It does get a bit crowded on weekends, but overall it‚Äôs a great place for family shopping.

This is truly a world class hypermarket comparable to what you will find in developed countries. Spacious, clean and beautiful.

It's not that they have only premium products. They have some selection of premium products combined with large selection of normal level products. Wide selection of veggies and meats. Also, veg and non veg food selection is appreciable.

You get some unique selections like roasted nuts with curry leaves available in loose quantity (any amount). Even old 90s style fruit bread is available.

Wonderful place to visit and shop. Enjoyable.

ops.insert: R. S. Puram is a residential area in the city of Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, India. It is named after the late Dewan Bahadur C. S. Ratnasabhapathy Mudaliar, who is regarded as the founder of modern Coimbatore. The area of R. S. Puram includes multiple commercial and residential buildings. Wikipedia.

Saibaba Colony is an area located in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, India. The Saibaba Temple is located there, and the name of the area is derived from the temple. The locality is mostly occupied by upper-middle-class people living in Coimbatore. One side is bordered by Thadagam road and the other side by Mettupalayam Road. Wikipedia.

Saravanampatti is a neighborhood of the Coimbatore city. It lies on the north-eastern part of the city. Saravanampatti is one of the fast-growing neighbourhoods of Coimbatore, because of the proliferation of IT companies in areas such as Saravanampatti, Peelamedu, Keeranatham, Vilankurichi, Kalapatti. Wikipedia.

Gandhipuram is a major place of the Coimbatore city in Tamil Nadu, India. It is named after Mahatma Gandhi. It was previously known as "Katoor".
Gandhipuram evolved as the major public transportation hub after the construction of the central bus terminus of the city in 1974. Wikipedia.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Coimbatore, often referred to as the 'Manchester of South India', is not just known for its textile industry but also for its vibrant architectural scene. The city is home to a diverse range of architectural firms that are pushing the boundaries of design, blending modern aesthetics with sustainable practices. From innovative residential spaces to striking commercial buildings, Coimbatore's architecture reflects the city's rich cultural heritage and its forward-thinking spirit. Whether you're wandering through its bustling streets or exploring its serene neighborhoods, you'll find a treasure trove of architectural gems waiting to be discovered.

At Wanderlog, we have a passion for uncovering the unique stories behind each building and the talented architects who bring them to life. In Coimbatore, firms like Beads Architects and 3Dots Architectural Studio are redefining the skyline with their contemporary designs, while others like Davidar & Associates and Ganapathy Architects are seamlessly integrating traditional elements into their work. Join us as we explore the best architectural offerings in this dynamic city, showcasing a mix of well-established firms and exciting new players that are shaping the future of Coimbatore's built environment.

reviews.reviewText:
Brookfield Mall, Coimbatore ‚Äî one of the city's most established retail destinations ‚Äî has been serving shoppers since 2009. Strategically located, the mall spans an impressive 4,50,000 sq. ft. and features a well-curated mix of international, national, and local brands. Its intelligent zoning, spacious corridors, and modern design ensure a seamless and enjoyable shopping experience.

The mall stands out not just for its scale, but also for its smart tenant mix. With ample parking, clean interiors, and a vibrant atmosphere,

It's really a beautiful shopping mall in coimbatore.

They have a HUGE parking lot, with lots of elevator's.-  I think they have around 8 to 10 lifts which work side by side.

It's really good place to spend time with your friends and do some shopping too

Brookefields Mall is one of the best places to spend time in Coimbatore if you're looking for shopping, dining, or just chilling indoors. üè¨‚ú® The location is very convenient, right in the heart of the city, and it's easily accessible by public transport, autos, and cabs. üöóüõ∫

The mall offers a good variety of branded outlets including Westside, Max, Lifestyle, and several international names. üõçÔ∏èüß•üëü Whether you're shopping for clothes, accessories, or electronics, there's something for everyone. The layout is spacious and clean, and the air-conditioning is always pleasant‚Äîespecially welcome in Coimbatore‚Äôs warm weather. ‚ùÑÔ∏è

The food court is decent with many choices‚Äîboth veg and non-veg‚Äîlike KFC, Dominos, Sree Annapoorna, and more. üçïüçóüçõ There are also some nice cafes if you want to relax with a coffee. ‚òïüßÅ The seating area can get crowded during weekends, but staff manage it well.

There's also a PVR cinema inside the mall which is well-maintained and a great option for movie lovers. üé¨üçø Washrooms are clean and hygiene standards are mostly well kept. The mall also offers free Wi-Fi and good security at all entry points. üì∂üõ°Ô∏è

The only drawback is that parking can be a bit hectic during weekends or holidays. üÖøÔ∏èüö¶ Also, it would be great if there were more seating areas for elderly people or those not interested in shopping.

We visited Brookefields Mall in Coimbatore during our trip with friends.

It‚Äôs a good place to spend some time, especially since there aren‚Äôt many other entertainment options in Coimbatore.

The mall has a decent selection of shops for shopping and browsing.

On the top floor, there‚Äôs a kids' play area which is quite good and helpful for families with children.

The food court offers a good variety of food choices and is a nice place to sit and relax.

Overall, it‚Äôs a comfortable and convenient place to hang out with friends and family when in the city.

I recently visited [Brookfield mall], and it truly lives up to the hype of being a one-stop destination for shopping, dining, and entertainment. The mall is massive, well-organized, and easy to navigate despite its size. There's a wide variety of stores, ranging from high-end brands to more budget-friendly options, making it suitable for every kind of shopper.

The food court is impressive, offering everything from quick snacks to full meals, with both local and international cuisine. I also appreciated the cleanliness of the restrooms and common areas, as well as the friendly customer service throughout.

One of the highlights was the entertainment zone ‚Äì whether you‚Äôre into movies, gaming, or just lounging around with coffee, there‚Äôs plenty to do. Parking was convenient, with ample space and clear directions.

Overall, it‚Äôs a fantastic place to spend a day with family or friends. I‚Äôd definitely recommend visiting, especially during weekdays when it‚Äôs a bit less crowded.

reviews.reviewText:
Just visited this amazing car and science museum! The car collection was incredible, spanning from colonial-era classics to modern marvels from the 2010s. Detailed descriptions for each model made it a treat for car enthusiasts.
The science museum was equally impressive, showcasing vintage household appliances that gave a fascinating glimpse into the past. A must-visit for kids (and kids-at-heart!) to appreciate how far we've come. What truly impressed me was the impeccable maintenance of the exhibits - everything looked pristine and well-preserved.
We spent around 1.5 hours exploring both exhibits and left feeling inspired and informed. Highly recommend!

The Gedee Car Museum in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, is a unique automotive museum that showcases a vast collection of vintage and classic cars. Here's a brief history 12) (3: Founding: The museum was founded by GD Gopal in 2015 as a tribute to his father, Gopalaswamy Doraiswamy Naidu (GD Naidu), a renowned inventor, industrialist, and philanthropist. GD Naidu's Legacy: GD Naidu was known as the "Edison of India" for his innovative spirit and contributions to various fields, including engineering, agriculture, and education. He started collecting unique cars during his lifetime, which formed the basis of the museum's collection.
Museum Collection: The Gedee Car Museum features over 100 vintage and classic cars, including iconic models from brands like Rolls-Royce, Ford, Mercedes-Benz, and more.
Some notable exhibits include the 1925 Rolls-Royce Phantom 1 and the 1936 Mercedes 170V. Purpose: The museum aims to educate visitors about the evolution of the automotive industry, showcasing technological advancements and engineering marvels. It'sa popular destination for car enthusiasts, history buffs, and families.
Location and Timings: The museum is located at 734, President Hall Building, Avinashi Road, Coimbatore, and is open from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM, Tuesday to Sunday. Key Features:
Vintage Cars: The museum showcases a diverse collection of vintage cars from around the world, including Britain, Germany, Japan, France, Spain, and the United States.
Interactive Displays: While the museum primarily features static exhibits, some interactive elements and workshops may be available for visitors. Educational Value: The museum provides valuable insights into the history of the automotive industry, making it an excellent destinatioƒ± . for students and car enthusiasts.

Don't go with high expectations, as the exhibit features only a limited number of vintage cars on display. However, there are interactive models of car engines and gears where you can observe their working mechanisms, by shifting the gears yourself, which adds an educational and hands-on element. The entry ticket price is on the higher side, so it might not feel like great value for money if you're primarily interested in a vast collection of classic vehicles. Overall, it's a decent spot for enthusiasts who appreciate mechanical details and history.

reviews.reviewText:
V‚ÄØO‚ÄØChidambaranar Park and Zoo, popularly called VOC Park, is a compact zoological garden and amusement park in central Coimbatore, spanning about 4.5 acres  . Established in 1965, it was managed by the municipal corporation and once housed roughly 500‚Äì890 animals, including birds, mammals, and reptiles  . The park featured a children‚Äôs play area, aquarium, toy‚Äëtrain, and a ‚ÄúJurassic‚Äù dinosaur-themed section set within landscaped gardens  .

It also hosted fairs, cultural events and public celebrations on Republic and Independence Day, and contained over 200 tree species, including sandalwood  .

However, the zoo‚Äôs licence was cancelled by the Central Zoo Authority in January 2022, leading to its permanent closure and relocation of most animals to other state facilities. Plans are in progress to convert the premises into an aviary or bird‚Äëpark under municipal redevelopment efforts  .

Perur Patteeswarar Temple in Coimbatore is a must-visit for its divine atmosphere and stunning architecture. Built by the Cholas, the temple features a self-manifested Shiva Lingam, intricate stone carvings, majestic gopurams, and a gold-plated Nataraja in the Kanaka Sabha. The place is very peaceful, especially in the early mornings, and well maintained with good queue systems. General darshan is free, and special darshan is available for a small fee of ‚Çπ20. There's ample paid parking, nearby flower stalls, and clean surroundings. Located just 9 km from the city, it‚Äôs easily accessible and perfect for both spiritual seekers and heritage lovers.

Perur Patteeswarar Temple is one of the most spiritually uplifting places I‚Äôve visited. The atmosphere inside is very peaceful, and you can feel a deep sense of devotion all around. It's well maintained and usually not overly crowded, which makes it perfect for a calm darshan. Definitely a must-visit if you're in Coimbatore!

reviews.reviewText:
A Peaceful and Stunning Experience at Marudhamalai Temple
Visited Marudhamalai Temple and found it to be an incredibly peaceful and divine place, perfect for both devotees and tourists. The entire premises were well maintained, clean, and neatly arranged‚Äîcredit goes to the temple authorities and the support of local people.

We chose to walk up the steps to reach the temple, and although it was a long climb, the journey was worth every step. It became a beautiful experience, especially with my family.

The sightseeing and the artistic wall paintings inside the temple were truly stunning‚Äîabsolutely captivating. The vibrant colors and cultural richness made our visit feel very special. It was a colorful and spiritually uplifting day that we'll always remember.

A divine and peaceful experience!
Maruthamalai Temple is truly one of the most beautiful and spiritually uplifting places I‚Äôve visited. Located on a scenic hilltop, the views of Coimbatore city are breathtaking. The temple is clean, well-maintained, and surrounded by nature. You can either climb the steps or take the shuttle bus which is very convenient. Early morning visit is the best to avoid crowds and enjoy the calm atmosphere. Highly recommended for both devotees and nature lovers! üôè‚ú®

Maruthamalai Temple offers a peaceful and spiritually enriching experience. Nestled in the Western Ghats near Coimbatore, the temple is known for its scenic beauty, clean surroundings, and divine atmosphere. Whether climbing the steps or driving up, visitors are treated to panoramic views and a serene environment. The temple is well-maintained, the darshan is fulfilling, and the staff are helpful. It‚Äôs a must-visit for devotees and nature lovers alike.

Peaceful & Divine Experience ‚Äì Well-Organized Transportation

We recently visited Arulmigu Maruthamalai Subramaniaswamy Temple, and the experience was truly divine. The temple is located on a serene hilltop and is very easy to reach, even if you're staying 14 km away from the area.

We stayed near Gandhipuram, and opted for public transport. We took the 70-number bus, which dropped us at the foothills. From there, government buses are arranged to take devotees to the top. The shuttle system is well-managed, with tickets costing ‚Çπ20 one way. Even though there was a big crowd, three buses were running in rotation, so everything moved smoothly.

The atmosphere at the temple was filled with energy and peace. The queue management and transportation setup made the visit hassle-free. We got enough time for darshan and to explore every part of the temple calmly.

If you're planning to visit, I highly recommend using public transport‚Äîit‚Äôs affordable and efficient. A beautiful spiritual experience overall!

There's no crowd, but a long line is maintained. The visit is completed within 10 minutes, which is good, no special entry needs. The specialty is transparent. However, the temple's interior area needs improvement in terms of cleanliness.

A serene and spiritually uplifting experience! üõï‚ú® Arulmigu Maruthamalai Subramaniaswamy Temple is nestled amidst the scenic Western Ghats, offering a divine atmosphere and beautiful views. The climb up to the temple is peaceful, and there's also a bus facility for those who need it. The temple is well-maintained, and the darshan of Lord Murugan is truly soul-soothing. A must-visit for devotees and nature lovers alike!

Went to this temple during my first visit to Coimbatore. This temple is located 15km from the main city of Coimbatore. The temple is at the base of the hills of western ghats.
It is said to be over a 1000yrs old temple with visitors coming from all over India.

I went on Friday evening, the experience of going to the temple was not pleasant as we had to wait at the foothills for more than 1 hrs just to go to the top of the hill.
There are people manning the entrance of foothill with security. The stop vehicle movement and charge 20rs for parking.
The foothills to the entrance closes at 7pm, even local bus service to the top closes at 7pm.

Once you go to the hilltop, Darshan is available until 8:30pm.

The place has not developed much. Lots of inconvenience for visitors. No proper parking, lack of basic amenities like public toilet, drinking water etc.

Very limited shops near the temple.

The only good thing is having darshan of Lord Murugan. We were lucky to see Abhishekam of Muruga as well at 8pm.

Apart from that the place doesn't give a good temple atmosphere or a serene experience.

Govt must take up the task of developing the place at foothills with hotels and shops for visitors. May be due to forest area and western ghats they might have restricted the development activities also.

There are elephant movement at stairways when going towards the hilltop. Please be careful and do not litter the place.

Try visiting during morning hours on weekdays for a better experience.
Om Muruga.
Vetrivel Muruganukku Arogara.

This temple is one of Coimbatore‚Äôs proudest landmarks and also among the oldest. As a devotee, I truly hope to see more development, especially in terms of facilities during the summer season. We visited on an extremely hot day, and unfortunately, there were no special arrangements in place‚Äîsuch as shaded walkways‚Äîto help people cope with the heat. Devotees walking from the base of the temple really struggled due to the lack of shelter from the sun. Clean and well-maintained restrooms are also much needed. There's nothing wrong in taking inspiration from other places to improve the temple‚Äôs infrastructure, as long as it‚Äôs done without compromising its tradition and cultural heritage. Personally, I didn‚Äôt notice much development compared to my previous visit in the early 2000s.

When I visited this temple, I couldn't stop myself from watching & getting mesmerized by the Gigantic idol of Lord Vinayagar (Ganesh). The idol is 20ft in height and carved out of single stone brought from Uthukuli town. The temple was built in 1982.
The idol is the largest Ganesha idol in India.

A must visit temple in Coimbatore.

Shree Ganeshay Namah..

I witnessed to see the tallest Ganesha jee of India was mesmerized. Not permitted to take deity's photograph.

One of the famous temples of Coimbatore of Lord Ganesha. Big statue of Lord Ganesh. As per local source it is Asia's largest Ganesh Idol. New car buyers dedicated Puja here often.At a distance of 3 km from Coimbatore Junction, Sri Puliakulam Vinayagar Temple is a Hindu temple located at Puliyakuam locality of Coimbatore. It is one of the prominent Ganesha temples in Tamilnadu, and among the top places to visit in Coimbatore.

Also known as Arulmigu Mundhi Vinayagar Temple, Puliyakulam Vinayagar Ganesh Temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha, and the deity is called here as Munthi Vinayakar. Built-in the year 1993, the temple has the largest Ganesh idol in the entire Aisa. The idol of the Lord stands about 20 feet tall and is over 11 feet broad sculpted from a single massive rock by 21 highly skilled sculptors. The idol is seen sitting on the lotus flower with a pot of nectar which he is having through its trunk. Sculptors took 6 years to complete the idol. The idol has 4 hands, one hand holds a piece of Mahabharata writings, the other holds the Angus, one holding jack fruit, and in the other lotus flower.

The deity here is known as Vighnaharta and is believed as visiting this temple will relieve the sufferings and the pains. The major festival which is celebrated in the temple is Ganesha Chaturthi. It is a delight to see the idol beautifully decorated with tons of flowers. Elaborate rituals are followed and many people come to visit and get blessings from the Lord. It is a 10-day festival celebrated in the month of August-September, during the Hindu month called Bhadrapada.

Timings: 5.30 AM - 1 PM & 4 PM - 9 PM

Entry: Free

I've felt an intimate connection with my spiritual self during my visit. Would certainly recommend for a calming retreat.

My visit to the sacred Sri Ayyappan Temple at Siddhapudur was truly a soul-soothing and spiritually uplifting experience. Right from the moment I stepped inside the temple premises, I felt enveloped by a sense of calm and devotion that words can hardly describe.

The temple is beautifully maintained, radiating divinity and serenity amidst the bustling city. The main sanctum of Lord Ayyappa, adorned with exquisite decorations and the constant chanting of bhajans, fills the heart with deep devotion and peace. The rituals and poojas are performed with utmost discipline and dedication, making every visit feel sacred and fulfilling.

The temple architecture, though simple, exudes traditional Kerala-style charm, and the surrounding cleanliness adds to the overall divine atmosphere. The priests are very courteous, guiding devotees with devotion and respect.

Offering prayers here fills one with renewed faith, positive energy, and a deep connection with Lord Ayyappa. I left the temple premises with a heart full of blessings and a mind filled with tranquility.

A must-visit for anyone seeking spiritual solace in Coimbatore. Swamiye Saranam Ayyappa!

Swami Saranam
